sections.name: Gold Defender
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Construct
traits.text: A construct is an artificial creature empowered by a force other than necromancy. Constructs are often mindless; they are immune to bleed damage, death effects, disease, healing, necromancy, nonlethal attacks, poison, and the doomed, drained, fatigued, paralyzed, sickened, and unconscious conditions; and they may have Hardness based on the materials used to construct their bodies. Constructs are not living creatures, nor are they undead. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, a construct creature is destroyed.

traits.name: Golem
traits.text: Golems are a special type of construct. Golems are immune to almost all magic, but most have a weakness to certain spells.

traits.name: Mindless
traits.text: A mindless creature has either programmed or rudimentary mental attributes. Most, if not all, of their mental ability modifiers are –5. They are immune to all mental effects.

sources.name: Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City

link.name: Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City pg. 49
link.alt: Pathfinder #172: Secrets of the Temple City pg. 49

automatic_abilities.name: Death Throes
automatic_abilities.text: When the gold defender is destroyed, it melts into worthless slag. As it melts, it releases a 10-foot radius cloud of fumes and a 10-foot radius puddle of molten metal. Creatures that breathe fumes are exposed to gold defender poison. Creatures that move through the puddle take 10d6 fire damage. The fumes dissipate after 1 round and the puddle cools after 1 minute.

automatic_abilities.name: Golem Antimagic
automatic_abilities.text: harmed by cold (6d10, 2d8 from areas and persistent damage); healed by fire (area 2d8 HP); slowed by acid

automatic_abilities.name: Malleable Shape
automatic_abilities.text: The gold defender's body is made from soft gold, which is particularly pliable. If the gold defender is critically hit with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, the attack partially bends and reshapes the gold defender. The gold defender becomes clumsy 2 until it spends an Interact action to bend itself back into shape.

automatic_abilities.name: Vulnerable to Telekinetic Haul
automatic_abilities.text: Casting *telekinetic haul* on the gold defender squeezes its form, compressing it into a smaller and much more awkward shape. The gold defender becomes clumsy 3 and can't use Light Reflection. The gold defender must take a 1-minute activity, which has the manipulate trait, to restore its shape, removing the clumsy condition and restoring its Light Reflection.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

affliction.name: Gold Defender Poison

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

affliction.text: Any drained value from this poison is reduced by 1 every hour.

ability.name: Inexorable March
ability.text: The gold defender Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a DC 37 Fortitude save. On a critical success, the resisting creature takes no damage; otherwise, it is damaged as if hit by the defender's fist Strike.

ability.name: Light Reflection

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

ability.requirement: The gold defender is not in darkness
ability.effect: The gold defender reshapes its skin into a reflective surface that magnifies ambient light into a precise beam that burns all creatures in a 30-foot cone, dealing 14d6 fire damage (DC 31 Reflex save if the gold defender is in dim light, DC 33 Reflex save if it's in bright light). It can't use Light Reflection again for 1d4 rounds.
ability.failure: The creature takes full damage and catches fire, taking 1d6 persistent fire damage.
ability.critical_failure: As failure, but the persistent fire damage is 5d6.
